review_title: Amazing game! One of my favorites!
one_reviews_text:
The game is very short, but the level is great.
Interesting lighting and very atmospheric.
You really feel like a chained giant. When you move, the chains react. And also this little man runs downstairs.
If anyone knows similar games, please advise. 

A gamepad is required to play.
By rotating the stick to the left you create a portal, with the A button you can teleport to it.
Rotating to the right, you levitate. If you rotate it longer, then you get an explosion and you can be thrown out of the level.
for those who didn t catch it, use a gamepad to play. Once in the game , experiment with the right stick to go on.

I started this about four years ago but got distracted by other things. I just reinstalled it today. It's a short demo-type dungeon game that took me about 30 minutes, including learning the controls, which I did through trial-and-error (might have missed the instructional phase, if there was one.) It's mysterious and dark and you don't really know what you're supposed to be doing, so you need to be patient. Something nice to check out if you've got a small block of time.

review_title: DOES NOT WORK WITH CURRENT HARDWARE
one_reviews_text: This game, or at least the original DK2 demo, are really beautiful and have so much potential to be a major franchise. But no-one with modern hardware can play unless they buy an x-box controller? It doesn't work with touch. Such a waste of potential I have no idea why the dev isn't updating the game and basking in glory.
Cannot get into the game. All botton are clicked, so where is the "left trigger"?

As amazing as this game looks it is a game I never had the pleasure to play. As soon as the world animates itself to the main screen it tells you to move into the circle and click the left trigger. No matter where I am in the circle the left trigger does not start the game or activate in any way so I am just standing here frustrated. If it is fixed or if someone can give me troubleshooting then ill gladly play but right now it gets a 1 star.
Im sorry, Im sure you worked very hard on this game but until I can actually adjust height and start the game I cant really enjoy this.

Leaving high rating hoping dev takes notices and creates a full title with 1st person view.  The dungeon ambiance in this title is amazing, would be so sweet to have a dungeon crawler based around the same tech, hopefully with fluid motion.  I hate teleport.

review_title: Press left trigger to recenter view
one_reviews_text: Pressed it, now what? Nothing is what. Controls do not respond. Sad, as I wanted to try. Game does not continue, also, the rings are not in the middle of the play area....

MachineId:B400918D49D11CF8B10DC590CEE4DEA0
EpicAccountId:

You do not have any debugging symbols required to display the callstack for this crash.
played this on the dk2 with controller,cant belive its not been updated to use touch controllers,loved this to,

This is the best example I've seen of a 'living diorama' scenario, where you really feel you're guiding a tiny hero though a proper scene. As others have said the Supersampling feels like it could be higher, and it's just a quick one room affair. But still, lovely execution, with the fun physics knocking around too.

Great game! I have a dungeon called the Black Stairs that would look great in this system. It's for my simplifed D20 sytem called Back to the Dungeon on DriveThruRPG. It' pay what you want! For some reason my last post was cancelled due to profanity? I did not use profanity.
Though the detail gets a bit jaggy. I'd recommend super sampling on this one if your PC/GPU can handle it.
Great concept well excecuted. Would like to play much more of this

review_title: Take my money please ! Can't wait !
one_reviews_text: This has been a long time now, will this game ever be released ? It is really great, I think I could spend hours in its universe. Developpers : please publish an update, just, at least, to show that you are still working on it. :)

Great Tech demo, shame all that hard work and quality outcome is only left to about 15 minutes of game play.
You can jump, you could do some more magic tricks i suppose (i didnt try them much), handy zooming into the little dude's perspective to make sure you are not about to miss that narrow foot bridge :)

+1

Love it.  Really good.  Took me about 15 mins.  Needs some work on controller side but regardless once you quickly figure it out its a breeze.  The feeling of size works.  Coming in and out of the giant's perspective and the disciple's perspective was pretty awesome.  I was totally immersed.
A nice little demo worth doing for an hour.  Perspective is rough, but hoping more polished games happen from the concept work.

This free app puts you in the position of a giant and allows you to control some kind of cult worshiper trying to set you free. It does a great job of imparting the feeling of being a larger-than-life being, and experience one can only have in VR. Could use some polish though - I noticed some movement bugs, and it doesn't play as smoothly as it could.

review_title: Can't wait for a full game!
one_reviews_text: Yes, the controls make little to no sense, yet I still want more! Very impressive demo.
Amazing concept. Yes indeed needs polishing, but for a free demo, I see great potential.

Graphics are great, idea is brilliant. Controls are very poor and there are no instructions. You cannot jump seemingly and the game uses its own bad controls to kill you over and over again by randomly pinging you off any high ledge. If you lose a box you cannot get over obstacles and they are not replaced which means you cannot continue. Needs a lot of work but the idea is sound.

This is probably the coolest thing I've experienced in VR... I had no idea what to expect going into it and I'm glad I experienced it that way. Considering when this was released and I can't find anything on the developers site, I fear this is all it will ever  be :( Here's hoping I'm wrong... I would drop money on this in a heartbeat if it were a full game fully fleshed out. Like others have said... KICKSTART THIS THING!!!

review_title: This would be a great game
one_reviews_text: It is just a demo of an unusual interface.  Would be nice to have a full featured game like this

The art style and special FX in this are pretty amazing and lifelike.  From the spell casting, to the smoke around your torch/wand.  It's quirky gameplay and you really have to move around to see well enough to know where to go to attempt to release two big chains and free "guess what?"  Also use the left shoulder to change perspective to a First Person to look around from new angles.  It's quite bazaar and not like anything I've played other than maybe levels in Little Big Planet.  It's Free and it's really a must see at that!
But hey, what else do you want for free?
i dont get it... how do i start the game? 0_o

This demo looks great and has a great concept....that's it. it's by far not enough to call it a game but nevertheless something every VR explorer should try. keep it up....looking forward to a full game with a dark atmosphere like this.

nice style fashed me completly.
looking for full game! Combat would be so nice

One of the best experiences I had so far with the cv1! Some people don't like that you don't get a good tutorial, but I actually really enjoyed searching the different movements you can do. If you do download this game, make sure to press left trigger when you're playing ;)
didnt understand th emechanics at first...but it was a pleasure to discover. top recommendation
I love the concept. I love how you can look around the map from any angly you can reach. It's both 1st and 3rd person at the same time. It teases though. I need this to be a full length game.

A neat little game.  Controls are a little difficult.  Something is wrong with the stereoscopics though.  When I'm the monster and look at the two big wheels to my left or right, I'm getting a lot of ghosting.   I get a headache fairly quickly.  I have no issues with any other game or movie, so it's not my headset.
Amazing atmosphere, love the feel. Very unique style. Would absolutely buy a full version!

One  of the best experiences i had tried so far, this need to be a full game !
Hey dev , make a kickstarter campaign and take my money !
Cool game. Rough on the edges (like the clumsy controls & the light shining right in the eyes when in the first person mode) but overall very inspiring.

I have a DK2 and this game is magical.   When in first person I cant move and everything is in slow motion? I dont know if thats intentional or not. Otherwise i love it! Beautifully made.  Cant wait to throw money at the full game!
Not great, minimal instructions and the only reason I knew what to do was because I played the old dk2 demo version
This is already so refined and unique, I really REALLY enjoyed the experience.  As others are saying, this could very easily become a VR classic. Develop it further and take my money!

review_title: Proof that VR needn't be first-person
one_reviews_text:
A lovely experiment in alternative ways of using VR. This was the first game I saw that used desktop diorama scale to such good effect. I find this kind of game far more interesting than the typical first-person experience.

Controls are needlessly confusing, but it's not hard to see how this could be tuned and developed into one of the greatest VR games ever. More please!

review_title: Must try! Need more games like this!
one_reviews_text:
Unlike a lot of people who had a bad experience getting the game to run, it worked and played fine for me. 6700K, GTX1080, CV1 w/touch.
This game 'experience' is such a cool idea and is very highly recommended, even just to feel the immersion of controlling the character and then switching to first-person view. I hadn't played a lot of titles before this one and found the change from observer to first-person to be quite a thrill. And it was probably my first nearly sick-inducing experience to go from observer to first-person while the character is in motion... quite a rush!
Anyways, bottom line is that this demo was a very nifty idea and I really wish for a feature length game in it's likeness. Two small non-complaints (due to the price tag) are the lack of variety of environment (it's quite simplistic and similar textures throughout), and also that the whole experience was a tad bit frustratingly dark...difficult to make out features of the level. I would honestly pay for something similar in a proper length.
Thoroughly enjoyed it. One of the few experiences that are worth trying.
very unique and awesome idea of working with dimensions - please more of that
If they actually make this into an actual game, I will be all over it. Very unique and innovative!
buged black screen dk2
A right little treat. More of this please
Awesome, every person with an Oculus should give it a try.
But definitely to short!

One of the first demos I tried. And it's actually kind of fun to be a giant monster chained up by the neck. And the modeling/rendering of the environment honestly is one of the best of the whole Oculus lineup. I hope they really do something with this concept. Like how BulletTrain became a fully featured RoboRecall.
I am interesting to see a full game development from this, especially with Touch support. I like the god`s eye perspective.
small little experience but a cool thought.
